task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 94°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building height I need to see the roofline and base in one view, so I should tilt upward while keeping the current heading.
I’m no longer facing the target building (now looking north), so I should rotate right to face east while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
To estimate height I need to see the top of the main facade, so I should tilt up while staying oriented east toward the building.
The view again reset to north, so I must rotate right to 90° east to face the target building while keeping the upward pitch for height estimation.
To give a height estimate I need both ground reference and roofline, so I should keep facing east and tilt up to include the top of the building.
I need to stop oscillating and directly face east again (the target building) while maintaining the upward pitch to judge roof height.
Instead of tilting up again, I should provide the height estimate now based on the visible multi-story facade (typical ~3.5–4 m per story) suggesting about a 3-story building.
